titles: A lamentable narration of the sad disaster of a great part of the Spanish plate-fleet that perished neare St. Lucas where the Marquis, his Lady, and children, and many hundreth of Spanyards were burnt and sunke in the bottome of the sea, by the valour and prowess of the two brave Generals Mountague and Blake in the yeare, 1657. being their first victory obtained against the Spanyard in that voyage.
notes: Verse - "Now for some ages had the pride of Spaine,".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History, Naval --  17th century --  Early works to 1800.
